title: Must visit
review: Beautifully located at the top of the hills with great views of Pushkar and Mountains. There are two ways to reach the temple - either chair lifts or walk up there. Walking is good if you have health and time. Spend few hours. Monkey business is literally in plenty.  Try to visit during late evening, Sunset is breathtaking. You will not be disappointed

title: Savitri Temple Pushkar
review: A must for those on a religious trip to Pushkar

title: Great views of Pushkar!
review: Amazing view of the whole village of Pushkar, great for sunrise. The walk can be challenging for people who don’t like stairs but it’s relatively easy. To find it, just follow the mountain, looking at the cable car. You will find steps, take then to the top. If you feeling tired to go down walking you can always take the cable car down or the way around. I am not a big fan of the temple itself as I am not religious but the walk is great and the view breathtaking!

title: A most amazing view
review: Walk up the mountain, or catch the cable car for the most stunning views of the whole area. They do close for lunch so its worth checking how long you will have up there when you buy your cable car ticket. There is a beautiful temple on top of the mountain and a little gift shop. There are many monkeys up there so bring something to feed them if you like or buy something there as they do sell food for the monkeys. Don't get too close to them though . If you are coming to Pushkar I recommend a visit to this temple, and also the one on the opposite mountain if you are fit enough to walk up. A truly wonderful experience.

title: Good scenic view.
review: The temple is situated at the mountain top. There are 2 ways of reaching the temple from the base. either go walking or take a to and fro cable car, which is a good experience. There is asmall temple at the top, with good scenic view of whole city.

title: Hill Top Temple offers panoramic view of Pushkar
review: A very simple temple on top of the highest hill near Pushkar which can be accessed by steps by sport loving young people and also by rope way for easy going or those with less time in hand. It gives a breadth taking panoramic view of area around Pushkar with Brahma Sarovar in the center.

title: Go there for the view
review: We went there today by car from Ajmer. You won't find much traffic in Pushkar as you will follow the outer route to reach here thus avoiding the city. As mentioned by others, there are 2 ways to reach to the temple at the hilltop, through stairs or through ropeway.

title: Sunset
review: This temple is on the hill. There are two ways of going to the temple one is by way of stairs approx 1100 stairs and the other is the rope way . We had gone by using rope way or cable trolley you may call them. The best time to visit this place is when it is about to have sen set. A spectacular view of sunset and the whole Pushkar can be seen from the temple and the hills . Must visit

title: good workout
review: the new steps made the climb easier. if you feel being lazy, take the gondola, the views are fantastic, i hope they are opening a chai shop in the not finished building on top

title: 360 degree view
review: The temple is built on the top of the mountain and provides a 360 degrees view to the city of Pushkar. It is worth a visit by walk or gandola.

title: Holy place
review: After offering prayer at Brahma Temple we went to see Savitri Temple. Nice view of temple from hill top

title: A good workout to get there
review: The walk up the steep hill (20-30 minutes) via the steps required a great deal of effort and the cable car is essential for anyone who's not reasonably fit.  But the views are special, despite the temple itself being very small and not at all special.

title: Small but excellent temple
review: For reaching this temple trekking required so not recommended for aged people. natural location to visit so must plan for this. We have enjoyed lot here.

title: Great views from the top
review: We took the cable car up to the top but you can walk the 440 steps if you are feeling up to it.  Lovely views from the top

title: Great views & some merit
review: Lovely little temple overlooking Pushkar..... rough track up, I managed with a knee brace on ... was expecting it to be messy after reading some reviews... but actually quite clean & even a bin there.... great views

title: Great view from the top
review: Quite a vigorous climb which would be dangerously hot in summer. Which is why we took the cable car in winter. Curiously you can buy a ticket from the top one way but can only buy a two way from the bottom. The temple is unremarkable for non Hindu, but the view from the top is worth the visit. Cheeky monkeys make themselves at home at the top.

title: Fantastic views and a more lighthearted temple
review: Rope way up to the temple is a good idea and it’s fun for 100 rupees or whatever. Views are great. Temple is tiny which is also a bonus 2 mins and you’re done without feeling like a heathen .

title: Temple on top of hill in pushkar
review: Savitri mata temple is located on top of a hill close to Pushkar town. Ropeway facilities are available for reaching up the hill. In addition nice walkway also is built. Even to reach the ropeway boarding point people have to walk up considerably. Hence for senior citizens it is a problem. Savitri mata temple is very nice and has long history. Excellent view of Pushkar lake and surrounding places are extra bonus for pilgrims who go up the hill. Lots of my keys are around and they are somewhat ferocious.

title: On Ratnagiri hill
review: The Savitri temple is located on the Ratnagiri hill. Beautiful location to visit. Must visit place. We have took visit in morning time.

title: Breathtaking, in both ways!
review: Woke up at 5 to hike up the approximately 650 steps to the Savitri Temple. Breathtaking.

title: Small Temple on the Hill top
review: The temple is situated on a hill top which is connected by a rope way.the view of Pushkar is excellent from the Temple.

title: Lovely Place
review: We have visited first time this temple & it was really good to go by roapway. The only problem is the monkey in terms of numbers which makes you scare sometimes.

title: Amazing sunset
review: The temple is situated on a hill top accessible by cable car and stairs.

title: Great view
review: Savitri Temple is situated on a hilltop and it offers spectacular views of the whole city. To reach the hilltop, you can either take the stairs, which are about 1000 in number or you can take the ropeway. Best time to visit is in the evening so you can witness the sunset. Must visit.

title: Walk or cable car access
review: We walked up and down really enjoyed the  exercise even with the one aggressive young monkey. Temple not worth the trip if that is what you are going for

title: Good experience of Savitri temple
review: We recently visited Savitri temple at Pushkar. It is situated over a hill top. Very high indeed for elderly people. But that obstacle had been negated by very well organised cable car facility, managed by very good professionals. It is available from 8 am to 7-30 pm during Oct-Jan and from 7 am to 8-30 pm during Feb to Sept. Worth visiting place.

title: Peaceful temple at hieght
review: Lovely temple at hieght which makes this more peaceful. Rope way is yet another advantages of this place. Finish your journey early in morning to take blessings of Devi savitri .don't click photo inside Temple

title: Apart from the religious, beautiful views
review: No reasons are required from religious perspective. Other than that, just the sheer view from the top is a must. Cable car is steep and safe but can be scary for some. Others may enjoy the ride too because the view from the car too is superb. All in all after the lake, this is a must visit.

title: Family visit
review: Great place at Pushkar. You can take the ropeway up to the temple. Good place for family outing coupled with blessings

title: Very good views worth a visit
review: Its just a little far off from the main lake you can take an auto to drop there. Temple is at height which can be trekked [you need to be a good trekker] or simply take a ropeway. It remains closed during afternoon I think 12-3 pm.

title: OVERATED
review: I viewed all the wonderful reviews about this place & couldnt believe how overated it was.

title: Amazing place for Sunrise
review: I went there at 6am to watch the sunrise, it's an amazing and beautiful experience everyone should do in Pushkar

title: Temple with a view
review: An interesting experience.  One can either walk or take a cable car.  Once at the top, there is an excellent view of Pushkar and Pushkar Lake.  Just be prepared for the monkeys when arriving at the top!

title: The view from top worth it!
review: We went the hard way to see Savitri Temple. We walked up the steep climb. The stairs have been made well except towards the end where they are too high so difficult for older people. The stairs were not particularly clean but it could be because we went up way too early to see the sunrise. The temple itself has lost the feel of an old temple with the constructions for the cable car, cafe on the side, terrace for the temple and all seems half finished. The front of the temple has been tiled unnecessarily and its a pity it has been renovated rather than restored. The view is just amazing though. Once can see the entire Pushkar town and the lake in the middle looks beautiful in the morning light. I was also happy to discover that Sharada Ma (wife of Ramkrishna Paramhansa) had visited the temple and that attracts a lot of Bengalis.  One can see many marble tiles donated by them. The temple is over all clean. Wish they would beautify it a bit. The journey down we took a cable. It was interesting but the cable car windows are stickered so visibility  is poor. A pity.

title: great place
review: we really enjoyed this temple ride with ropeway because without that you can not come as it is on a high hill. it was good to see pushkar from the top but there are lot of monkeys.

title: Amazang view
review: The temple is under construction and does not deserve a visit, but the view across the city and the lake is amazing

title: Panoramic view
review: It is an experience you will never f hdorget to see Pushkar from a bird's eye. Great place to enjoy view and cool breeze. Temple is also nicely maintained but place around is not clean.

title: A Temple on the top of the Hill
review: Savitri Temple is a must-see tourist destination in Pushkar. Besides the religious sentiments associated with the temple the place has an added attraction in the form of a cable car ride which gives a panoramic view of the Pushkar town. However one can walk up the few hundreds stairs which are not that uncomfortable. You will be greeted by a not-so-disciplined group of langurs at the gate of the temple; so one has to be careful. The view of Pushkar town from the top is beautiful.

title: Amazing sunset views in Pushkar
review: I started visiting this hill too temple 10 years ago and I have seen it pristine without a ropeway they recently built and without trash. Barring the above the views are gorgeous at sunset. Leave at least couple hours prior to sunset and don’t carry eatables as the monkeys can go crazy and attack as well. He walk is steep about 14-45 mins depends on your fitness level and the other options is the rope way off course !

title: Very nice viewpoint
review: To get here, we drove from Pushkar through the Camel Fair grounds, and parked at the bottom of the hill where the cable car starts, and took the cable car up; though you can climb up a lot of steps to get here if you want. The cost was about Rs. 90 I believe for round trip.  On the way up, the cable car stops once half way, to let others on and off at the top and bottom. Make sure you save your ticket for the return else they will NOT let you on. A tourist couple had a hard time convincing the staff at the temple that they had bought return tickets but had lost them.

title: Good Experience
review: Had a wonderful rope way experience . The whole city view was mesmerising ..... Would wish to visit agAIN ...

title: Beautiful at sunrise
review: The view from the top is worth it if you can make it. The hike up is long and requires some amount of physical endurance. Watch out for the monkeys and the stray dogs along the way.

title: Great View from the Top
review: A great temple at the top and a wonderful ropeway to reach it. Must visit when in Pushkar. Lots of Monkeys around.

title: JAI HO SAVTRI MATA KI
review: whenever i m in pushkar i always went there

title: Temple visit
review: Great view of pushkar from the hill Top Savitri Temple also monkeys kept us amused and we enjoyed climbing up also there is cable car at nominal cost, the view is incredible. Reccomend this to everyone

title: Great view for sunset
review: Well worth a trip if you’re in Pushkar. Great views and a lovely sunset. The monkeys are very cheeky and make sure any food is hidden! But it is really fun watching them. We took the cable car up but the walk didn’t look too challenging.

title: good views ....
review: lots of steps to get to the top.

title: Breathtaking view
review: You have to take a cable car to reach the top of the hill where the temple is location. The cable car ride makes you bit nervous but the view from the top is every bit worth the trip.

title: a nice hilltop temple
review: This temple in Pushkar is situated on the top of a hill and is connected by a ropeway. The ropeway was very good and well maintained. The staff were courteous and efficient. It was a thrilling experience going up. The temple is a very ancient one and the diety is savithri wife of Lord Brahma. We had a good darshan and the view from the top was great. Worth visiting this place while in Pushkar

title: Beautiful view of Pushkar
review: Loved the way up by rope way. We get a complete view of Pushkar plus the Rann backside. Too many monkeys there..... Beware of your belongings. Savitri Mata temple is small but good. They will soon have a viewing gallery.

title: A Fantastic View of Pushkar
review: This temple has recently have a cable car installed with a magnificent view of the city as well as a sunrise n sunset point.

title: A challenging walk but great view!
review: We opted to walk rather than take the cable car which is the quickest option! The steps in places are rather steep, but are in good order but the handrail is missing in places! The temple is rather plain but still interesting to see but the view is stunning and you can get a nice cup of chai from the cafe behind the temple. Lots of people come up for the sunset which was quite good too. Interesting to visit if you have enough time.

title: Nice temple
review: There are lot of monkeys to see , beautiful view of city , u can enjoy rope way , u can click a beautiful panorama pics from high point

title: Hill top temple
review: There is a religious significance about this temple. It's on top of the hill. You can use the steps.. Some say 600-some say 1000. I have climbed the steps but haven't counted. It was a nice experience walk g up the stairs. Wasn't an easy climb but wasn't like undoable either. If you are used to a medium fitness routine one can easily do the climb. But other wise there is a rope way also. Savitri mata is very kind and inside the temple i just felt home. For who can't climb up, there is a rope watmy too with minimum cost.

title: Devi Temple
review: You may either use the tram to go to the temple or use the steps. Go there before the afternoon sun to enjoy the temple. The entire trip would take up to 1 hour.

title: Religious place
review: We visited here with my whole family. It is very peaceful and calm place. You can climb here by steps (Approx 800 to 1000). There is also facilities of cable car which can be used if needed. Nice place to visit.

title: Beautiful Temple
review: 950 steps was daunting, but, the cable car was a blessing.

title: Can’t believe this is Pushkar
review: We never expected scenic beauty on top of Savitri temple. You will not believe that u are in Rajasthan as it was all green around. Also rope early was the great experience for children.

title: Excellent View
review: Beautiful view of Pushkar town and very close to nature. Temple is very good. It is on hill top, people are very friendly

title: Great view from the top!
review: You can hike to the place or you can use the cable car. There are a lot of steps, so beware. But the view from the top, is amazing. Worth the visit, better to go for sunset or sunrise.

title: Great views over Pushka
review: Well worth the trip to the top. We took the cable car up and walked down. Mind the monkeys. They will grab any bags that look like food. Fantastic views over Pushka.

title: must visit place
review: To reach Savitri temple you need to take the ropeway cable car. Please keep 30 mins aside from this temple. It is an experience to reach to this temple.you can see a whole Pushkar from hilltop temple.

title: Holy place..
review: A old temple located at Hill top. Best way to reach there is cable car which is cheap as well. You may also option for hiking which is not very tough. Go in the morning for best vally view. Beware of monkies.

title: great view but beware the monkeys
review: crazy monkeys await you when you get off the cable car or walk the steps, we saw a few people getting attacked.  but apart from that, beautiful views.  especially go for a walk along the mountain ridge.

title: Beautiful place. Would be amazing view in monsoon.
review: It was very hot when we visited this place, yet it offered a spectacular view. This place would be a paradise in monsoon. Be ware of monkeys though.

title: Worth climbing the stairway to temple!
review: The stairs to the temple seem to never end but I’d recommend it anyway! Go early in the morning to avoid the crowd and the harsh sun and do take the cable car for the way back down!

title: The Savitri Devi Temple
review: Savitri temple is situated on the top of Aravali Hill. It gives the best aerial view of holy town of Pushkar. The temple is not open full day, there are certain time of opening, so better confirm the time before going. There are two option to reach to the temple one is by climbing the stairs and there is a rope way as well. The temple is bit away from lake and other attractions, so you better take a rickshaw or you can drive your own vehicle.

title: okay
review: It is good place to visit on a rainy day but not advisable to visit in summers. It is on the top of aravalli hills.

title: Great Experience
review: Reaching to the temple through Stairs is good if you want to burn the calories and have plenty of time to spend in Pushkar. People with Short trips and typically Weekend trips. MUST try Ropeway.

title: Worth one visit.
review: If you don't have any spiritual commitment to that place, it's a single visit worth.

title: Must visit when you are at Pushkar
review: You must visit this place when you are At Pushkar. 360 degree view from from the Rope Car while you go up will definitely delight you.  If you do not have your own car or conveyance it is better to take an Auto to save time.  Not to wait for any public transport.

title: Awesome climb up Pushkar Hill
review: Don’t miss out on walking up this hill. It’s a fairly long hike up but well worth it. There is a sweet temple (of goddess Savitri) with amazing views of Pushkar at the top. We did the hike early morning when it was nice and cool. Never took the ropeway. No need. The hike is extremely do-able especially if you pace yourself!

title: Superb Place
review: I must say that this is the best place of pushkar which lot of people don't know even. You have a option to go by stairs which are too many in nunbers or else you can take a roapway which is much easier as it is on a quite high height. love to see the entire pushkar from top. must come place

title: Get a workout and see sunrise from the mountain top
review: The draw for this temple is the view, not the temple itself, which is small, plain, and unfinished. The 365 degree territorial view is wonderful.  There is a cable car to the top, but it won't be open for sunrise.  Plan on a half hour hike from bottom to top.  Lots of monkeys at the top that may mug you if you take food along -- not recommended.

title: Top of the pushkar
review: its a very good place to vist with the help of roapway and you can see the entire pushkar from top. Only one problem is their that they have too many monkeys which troubles you.

title: Tough walk up but worth it
review: We didn’t take the cable car up and instead walked up instead, was a little steep but definitely worth the views at the top

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: Breath taking views! Lots of monkeys and a great couple of hours out! We took the cable car up and walked down the stairs, make sure you have plenty of water if your choosing the stairs route!

title: Dull temple good view of Pushkar
review: This rope car ride is hampered by the dirty Windows so seeing out to the view is hindered. This is  ride to nowhere as once at the top the temple is awful a big money box !

title: Great view at sunrise.
review: Get up early and climb up the steps to this temple on the top of a hill on the adge of the city to greet the sunrise ( and the monkeys)  worth it.  I was a bit disappointed that there was too much litter there but this was one of my overall disappointments on this trip in Rajasthan. There is a cable car that will save you the trouble of the climb but not as rewarding!!!

title: Best view and nice temple
review: Go for sunset. It's beautiful, with the monkeys and everything. We walked up - takes around half an hour from the foot and one hour from Pushkar Lake.

title: Worth it
review: We woke up early to try to see sunrise there, didn't work...we left around 7...walked until the temple, it's a bit hard but totally possible! Worth it! Take lots of water with you. Cable car starts at 08:00am so we were able to take it to come back. INR71.00 per person. I recommend it a lot!

title: Very good temple
review: SaciThe Savitri temple in Pushkar is located on the Ratnagiri hill which is a popular pilgrimage site for the Hindus. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Savitri. It is a very strenuous work to climb on the hilltop but it is believed that the harder you work the more ‘Tapas’ are gained. In this temple you will find the idols of

title: Beautiful temple and perfect spot for the sunset
review: The temple is very peaceful and the ridge behind it is a great place to sit and watch the sun disappear into the haze.  The walk up is great exercise, and walking down at night is well lit and the steps are in good condition.  I did not ride the cable car, so cannot comment on it.

title: Little climb or cable car experience, a lot of monkeys, good place for photos
review: Good view , possibility to ride on a cable car or you can climb - it’s easy not so high, about 30 min walk. Monkeys are waiting for food upstairs, take some bananas and camera

title: Recommended to Visit.. Nice view of Pushkar Lake
review: On the hills. Scenic, beautiful and serene. Must visit if visiting Pushkar. Rajasthan government constructed a rope way to travel up making it easy to reach to temple and  It takes 5 minutes.

title: Sunset fun.
review: Do visit during sunset and spend some time with friends there. cable car is a good option if you dont wish for a sweaty climb. it costs around  Rs.115  two way

title: Total view of Pushkar from top.
review: Nice place . The topmost point of pushkar. Rope way charges Rs.104 to reach the top. But for photography lovers walk all the way up and enjoy the view. Complete pushkar is viewable.

title: Good View of the City
review: take the Ropeway-car or climb the stair while you enjoy the view of the city and the hills guarding the city..

title: For the view
review: The temple itself on this hill summit is without the slightest interest but the view over Pushkar and the neighbouring hills and countryside is superb. There is a well paved way leading up or a cable car for an easy access in 10 minutes. You can walk there from town without problem.

title: Great...
review: Great place to visit. We went there by cable car. Temple is just beautiful. But we enjoyed the view of city and sunset from the top of hill.

title: Offers panoramic view of the town
review: It offers sweeping views of Pushkar town and lake. Go for an early morning or late evening hike for sunrise and sunset.

title: temple ok ok but view amazing
review: temple not maintained but view from the savirti temple is amazing and cable are essayist way to going there.

title: Lovely sunset!
review: One of the highest points in Pushkar. We went up the cable car and came down by the steps. A fun downhill stroll. The sunset is epic.

title: Beautifiul view
review: This can be reached by either trekking up the hill or by taking a cable car. The view from the temple is breathtaking and once can see the entire pushkar from here.This place is a must visit. The temple is very peaceful.

title: jai mata ji
review: good temple on a  mountain. added attraction is to reach there by rope way.temple surounded by arravali hills full view of ajmer and pushker

title: Temple on the top of hil
review: So this temple is on a great height as to go there you have to  take around 1000 steps or you have the other option which is rope way that cost you around 103 rs for both the sides and yes you can see  the amazing view of the city pushkar

title: Ascension to the spiritual
review: One of the sacred places for Hindus, very spiritual, and also a good trek of 40 min. We have been there at the sunrise. Level difference 200 m, distance 1,5 km from base to top, 650 steps, medium difficulty. A beautiful panorama of Pushkar from top.

title: Just sit and stare a while
review: We went at sunset our last night in Pushmar and it was lovely. We thought we'd be on time with a 45 minutes to sunset but with the lines for tickets and cable car plus the ride up we just missed it at the top.

title: Beautiful view
review: A must visit place if you come to Pushkar. They have just installed a Rope way last year. Easy approach and excellent view of pushkar and Aravali hills.

title: mountain top temple
review: beautiful temple and the best way to going via cable car price is very cheap for the cable car and hill view is superb.

title: Spectacular view
review: Decided not to do the cable car and walked the 700 plus steps. The views were spectacular and the meeting and encounters of the local people and worshipers was fantastic. Really well worth the exercise and to spend time marvelling at everything on the way up.

title: Beauty in need of preservation
review: The view is really really beautiful.

title: climb or take ropeway but must do
review: pushkar needs to be seen from above as its a special place both for spirituality seeking pilgrims and comfort seeking escapists. try feeding langoors here or watch the sunset behind the temple

title: Temple with cable car
review: Savitri temple is located on the top of a steep hill near the main town of Pushkar.

title: Cable car ride to the temple is pretty awesome
review: The temple is up a tall mountain and you can take a cable car or walk up the stairs, We took the easy option of Cable car. The view from the cable car is awesome. The temple is beautiful and ancient.

title: Walk up and ride down :)
review: We arrived at the bottom around 5:30pm with a large queue for the lift, so decided to walk. 2/5 of us were lucky enough to catch the sunset. 80rs for up and down, I think we paid 70rs for just one way. Best views of pushkar

title: Very good Lookout over Pushkar Lake and surroundings
review: We traveled there with the new cable car to see the sunset. From the city with Tuk-Tuk you need about 15 minutes + cable car or footpath to the top. The view is very good and the mood is really relaxing. Just pay attantion to the Apes, they look cute but can be very aggressive.

title: Awesome views
review: We drove to the place. A rather long wait in line but the cable ride is fun and the view is awesome. For the religious there is the temple too. Watch out for the monkeys!

title: relax
review: visit this place see the simple life very nice take half day off enjoy this lovely area off the small city in to peace of mind

title: View from the temple
review: Enjoy a breath taking view of pushkar town and the sarovar from this temple. The Savitri temple is dedicated to godess Savitri , first wife of lord Brahma  and is believed to be staying here on the mountain showing her remorse after her husband married godess Gayatri.

title: Sunset over the desert
review: The temple itself is not spectacular but the view from here is.  There is a cable car to the top of the hill on which the temple is built or you you can walk up the (vry long) flight of steps. We arrived in time to watch the sunset over the Thar desert.  Very romantic!

title: Amazing view from the top
review: Take the Cable Car to reach the top . Please find out the temple timings before you start for the ride. Spend a good time to view the entire Pushkar City from the top. You can safely have the Soda Shikanji on yoru way back . Very unfortunate to see small kids begging for alms , money and even food ( they do it out of habit rather than need )  . Do not fall in to the trap .

title: Spiritual Journey
review: The visit happened by chance, we were staying at Hotel Bhanwar Singh Palace Pushkar. Had visited Pushkar Fair the evening before and someone suggested to visit Savitri Godess Temple. It was about 15 mins drive from hotel. We used GPS, it works perfectly fine in Pushkar, unline Mideast where I stay. There is ample parking space, no parking charges here. Best part was now visitors have to no longer make the climb of 2 hours to reach the temple. Recently started ropeway/cable car is a great option. Charges around 130 rs per person (approx). At   one time which is every 15 mins, they can take 18 people with 3 cable cars, so on a usual day you have to wait around 30 mins. Which is worth the wait. Bit crowded, but then you are visiting a holy place in India.

title: Panormic View
review: The ropeway has made it very convenient to have a panormic view of the entire town of Pushkar. The temple has great historic significance and is very symbolic in Hinduism. It has special significance for Hindu married women and so a lot of women from all over India come and visit this temple not once but many number of times.

title: Great views of Pushkar
review: We took the cable car uphill - the car itself was closed on all sides and therefore not as much fun. The views from the top were pretty good - overlooking the entire Pushkar town.

title: Pushkar Visit
review: Beautiful place. a must visit in pushkar. one can use a roap way to enjoy scenic beauty. go n enjoy the mountain view

title: Nice walk to holy temple of Savitri
review: You can see a wonderful view of Pushkar lake and surrounding countryside from the hill top of the tample. We walk up to the top quite early in the morning

title: Must visit for the Complete Pushkar View
review: The temple of Goddess Savitri is situated at the top of a hill. You can get a complete view of complete Pushkar from the top.

title: hill top temple
review: hill top temple can go via cable car that is around 100 inr for both way higly recommended this place

title: A beautiful Sunset Point
review: A peaceful and beautiful place to spend your evening, watching sun goes down.Its a must if you are in Pushkar.

title: Sunrise View
review: If you want to see an amazing view of Sunrise, then this is the place for you in Pushkar.  Being a photographer I can say that I got some amazing shots here. Reach around 45 mins before sunrise here, as the place requires climbing some steps and then trekking. But it is really worth it. You get to see the whole pushkar city from this place and the distance if the weather is clear, you can see ajmer lake as well. A must-visit place in the morning in Pushkar.

title: Sunset view and birds eye view of Pushkar
review: The sunset view from the top of the temple along with the bird's eye view of Pushkar makes this a must visit! It takes about 40-45 minutes to hike up the temple(about 1000-1200 steps) and you can relax on the top of the temple with tea and snacks!

title: Small temple on hill top
review: This is one of the much hyped tourist attraction when you are in Ajmer. However, this is just a small temple for Savitri mata. Located at 2km from the Brahma temple of Pushkar.

title: Good climb and great views
review: If you are feeling up to climbing 925 steps- some of them big ones - this is definitely worth doing although the hideous lift station takes away the magic when you arrive at the top. That is unless you have taken that way up!  We went up at 6am to watch the sunrise over Pushka. There were just a few pilgrims up there so very peaceful. When back down we went to the ghats which were magical.

title: Amazing view point, make sure you go for sunrise!
review: This is by far the best view from above in Pushkar. I would highly recommend the sunrise trek and watch the colours transform infront of your eyes. It's quite a walk and some of the steps are huge but it's worth it.

title: Must Visit
review: To reach Savitri temple you need to take the cable car. Please keep 45 mins aside for this temple. It is an experience to reach to this temple.

title: Short hike with a great view
review: It's a short 45 minute / 700 ft. hike from base to top. If you're walking all the way from  the city add another 15-20 mins. It'sy easy and can be done by anyone. For the more lazy people, there's a cable car but expect long queues. The views are scenic and offer a great aerial view of Pushkar.

title: Morning Energizer
review: Early morning wake up in Pushkar with a walk in the dark to ascend the over 900 steps to reach the Savitri temple. Morning rise with a mug of morning chai in hand. great way to start your day in Pushkar. Go for it!

title: 500 step super workout for a heavenly view
review: Love pushkar for this amazing hike, 3 km from the city around 500 steps take you to the most breathtaking view & a temple. Great way to start your day !

title: Perfect sunrise destination
review: We rose at 5am to hike to Savitri Mata for sunrise (around 6:27am in October), it took us about 50 minutes from the south side of Pushkar Lake.

title: Nice View Point of Puskar
review: We have visitied here by Cable Car . This is on a hill top . The View of Puskar is Spectacular from here .  One can take photos of Puskar and Araballi Hills from here .

title: Need modernisation of place
review: This place has great potential to be a tourist spot, but need upgradation of facilities available. more cable car. better roofs.

title: Amaing view of pshkar from hill top
review: Too steep rope way to hill top, nice experience to have. also you will get some amazing view from top try to go wither in early morning or evening. Temple closed in after noon.

title: Amazing Ropeway
review: The new rope way cable car is n amazing experience. The cable car is stopped mid way to allow the yatris the thrill of height and George on the scenic beauty of the Pushkar

title: rubbish temple, nice view
review: The temple is not even  worth a visit unless you are going to worship but the view is nice and it gets a cool breeze up there. The cable car is ok. don't forget to scream when it suddenly stops half way and freak out the rest of your gondola. lol.  Best thing is westerners don't have to pay any more than Indians for once so go for this reason and enjoy. The summit is a mess of a building site.

title: Good Ambience
review: From top of the Sawatri Temple it gives a good scenic view and with Ropeway the visit is comfortable to & fro.

title: Breathtaking views
review: This is great activity to do whilst in Pushkar if you are looking for some morning exercise. It takes about an hour to walk from Lake Pushkar up to the top of the hill where the temple is situated. However, the temple itself is not the main attraction, rather it is the panoramic view of Pushkar and the surrounding area below. You will want to avoid the heat of the day so the best time to set off is about an hour before dawn and then you will see the sunset from the top. The walk requires a moderate level of fitness and as you near the top the steps become steeper. The view from the top makes it all worthwhile, it is stunning!

title: Perfect Sunrise
review: This is a beautiful spot to watch the sunrise. It's an easy climb up slightly crumbly steps to the top and the vistas are truly spectacular. When you come back down after watching the sunrise, take a walk through town. Pushkar is particularly beautiful just after dawn.

title: Get together of family
review: This temple is located in a hill near Puskar lake. You can climb the hill by steps or even use the cable car on purchase of tickets. The beautification work of the temple was in progress once completed it will be very convenient to cost. The view from the top of the puskar city and lake is breathing. You need to take care of the Langurs (black face Monkey with long tale) they are not aggressive but smart. You can feed them gram on sale at a small tea shop.

title: Excellent temple at such Location and hight
review: Without visiting savitri temple your trip at puskar will incomplete.

title: Great view and climbing exercise, Temple is mediocre.
review: The view is amazing from the top of this hill, but sadly the temple is just mediocre when it comes to amazing temples of India. The exercise you get from climbing up is great though! If you are in Pushkar it is definitely something cool to do! If you don't choose to climb and take the cable car, then the views are the only thing worth going to the top for!

title: Picnic to ajmer pushkar
review: A worthwhile visit to savitri mata temple and the rope way has made it very convenient for the visitors

title: Good view
review: The temple was unfortunately closed when we went. But the view of the city was spectacular. We took the cable car to reach the top.

title: must visit temple in Pushkar
review: There are lots of temples in Pushkar and this temple is situated on the top of a mountain. There is a rope-way system to go up and come down, the cost being Rs.92/head for 2-way journey. We climbed up by rope-way and preferred coming down by steps. The view pf the Pushkar town including the lake and all its 52 ghats, from the top is awesome. Try to see the sunset from the mountain.

title: Savitri Temple
review: Fantastic views of beautiful Pushka. An exciting little cable car ride to the top, then an invigorating walk back down!! A must for tourists in the adorable little town of Pushkar.

title: The view!
review: The Temple is situated at a height such that you have to climb 500 odd stairs to reach the temple. We started early morning to see the sunrise and reached the temple in 25 min. But due to the clouds sun was covered, but the view was amazing!! You could see the Pushkar lake and all the greenery around you.

title: Good view. Temple not impressive.
review: We got the cable car up. The steps are endless and in the heat of the afternoon these did not look fun!

title: Very good views
review: With a cable car to the temple, it has become a tourist attraction. The charges for cable car are Rs105/- for both ways

title: Savitri Temple
review: Another very important temple which must be visited while in Pushkar. The best way to get here is of course by Cable Ropeway, but the determined and the faithful also walk up the steps which look easy but get steeper as you near the top. The view from the top is breathtaking. Nothing much to do there except to offer your prayers and enjoy the view.

title: Sweaty but worth the climb
review: We took the stairs not the cable car..amazing view of Pushkar and pushkar lake! The temple was kind of blah.. go for the view!

title: very good view
review: try rope way   to reach for the temple ,  the view surrounding the mountain is very beautiful. temple is very old .

title: Visit to Savitri Temple
review: Savitri Temple is located on the Hill Bang Opposite to Bramha Temple. You can reach there through Stairs or Ropeway. It takes almost 40 minutes to clim through stairs and only 6 minutes through ropeway. However, those who are scared of Heights get uncomfortable in ropeway. My wife being one amongst such person. So judge your partner in the ropeways before you get into :-)

title: the view is okay.
review: Decided to visit the temple on top of the hill, walked from the hotel and that took about half an hour so I suggest getting a tuk tuk to the foot of the hill.   Caught the cable car up to the top and the views are great, overlooking pushkar town and lakes, so it is worth it for the views.   The temple isnt too much and you cant take photos inside.

title: Best views of Pushkar and surrounding areas
review: Ropeway to Savitri Temple is a good attraction. Plan your trip in advance to ensure you don't reach their when temple is closed I believe 12 pm to 1 pm. We reached there at wrong time and waited for an hour at the top for the temple to open. A lot of renovations were going on their in Jun'17. Hopefully people will find better facilities in coming months. The view of Pushkar lake from top is mesmerising.

title: "Amazing view of Pushkar from Savitri Temple:
review: Enjoy "Udan Khatola" to reach at Savitri temple. Its a very nice temple and here from i see the beautiful  view of the city.

title: Wonderful view
review: We walk from Pukar tp this temple. this temple from on the mountain  and one kilometer far from Pushar town and you can see wonderful view.

title: Amazing view
review: The temple is not much to look at just sort of a concrete shell but the view of pushkar is spectacular and the I couldn't get enough of the many monkeys who live up there. They are by no means tame but they aren't scared of people and will leave you alone if you leave them alone. They were fantastic to watch especially with their babies and it was really special to watch the sun go down. We walked to the top which wasn't easy but wasn't what I would call difficult, just a couple of breaks needed and it made the view at the top all the worthwhile. There is always the cable car though if walking not your thing.

title: Worth the view!
review: We took the rope car to experience the same ; @ 100 rupees per person (up and won)onward journey was good as the queue were well organized however once on top and returning back in the cable car was a bad experience non existent queues, less number staff to help and people breaking the line had caused a ruckus however thanks to a few travelers there a queue was organized and we were able to catch the rope car to come back.

title: Best place to have the bird-eye view
review: This is a must go place for the tourists. It is located away from the hustling and bustlings of the city. I realized that the best time to track there is during the morning. I am sure, Photographers would love to make photos from the top. The well built steps are close to 200 and in good conditions. There is a facility of cable-car also. You need to buy the tickets from the down. You can not buy it from the top. There is a water supply of drinking water so you can take rest in the waiting area until the gates are opened post lunch.

title: Beautiful
review: Got the lift up the beautiful mountain to the temple. Super cheap. Amazing view of pushkar. We need a scooter to get there tho

title: Ropeway
review: Beautiful view from rope-way and they charge 92 rupees and top side lord Brahma wife temple. and many money around the temple side.

title: rope way
review: we reached at temple in evening time and that was best time. camp is located on heights so we can explore whole pushkar city.

title: Enjoy rope way and view of aravali valley
review: Best way to go Savitri temple via rope way A rope-way is an easy and reasonable way to travel to hilly location. Keeping this in mind, a new rope-way has been started in Pushkar. The rope-way has been constructed at Savitri Mata Temple. With the help of this rope-way, now you will be able to reach the 720 meters high temple in just 8 minutes.

title: The SAVITRI temple
review: Temple situated on a Hill of Arawali range,  You can go by Roapway or by narrow foot path, A must visit after worship of Lord Bramha. Lot of tempo founded near Lord Brahma temple for 5 kms. At the top of temple amazing view of pushkar city, Brahm sarovar (lake) seen.

title: Lovely view from Hilltop of savitri temple
review: At the top from the savitri temple great view rope way is the best option for going to savitri mata temple

title: Sweet hike, great views.
review: Loved this short little hike.  Took it the first day in Pushkar and it was perfect for getting a nice overview .

title: nice view and sun set
review: surrounding mountains were amazing!! Definitely worth it. Don't opt for the lift if you're physically able to walk.

title: For getting views of the city and lake
review: To get to the Savitri temple, walk around the temple of Brahma on the left and then along the dusty road about a kilometer or so. Then you will face a choice. On the right you will see the funicular, on the left - hiking uphill road to the temple. Now I would have done the same as I did then - I would go up to the temple by cable car, and went down on foot. The ascent is not difficult, but do not forget about the heat, which after 10 a.m. is already floating above the town and envelops all. The temple itself is unremarkable, but  the  views of the city and lake from the top of the hill with temple redeem everything. For getting them you need to come here and not listen to the confused  legends about the relationship between different goddesses and Brahma. Чтобы сидеть в плетеных креслах, наблюдайте за незаменимыми обезьянами, слушайте музыку - и помните Пушкарь, как видно из этого.

title: Excellent View
review: The Savitri temple is on hill accesible by foot and through ropeway. The ropeway is a good option for Rs 92 per person for both ways. The ropeway is new and is very well maintained. In the middle it gets stopped for you to enjoy the topography. It starts at 9 am and last descent is at 7.30 pm. From 12 to 2 pm it is closed as the temple is also closed. Worth visiting the temple and to have a birds eye view of the Pushkar and sunset in the evening.

title: savitri temple is good for sunset view and sundown view and at the top whole pushkar view
review: savitri temple is good for sunset view and sundown view and at the top whole pushkar view good to going to morning and and evening time and rope way is best to goung there they charge only a 92 rupees per person.

title: Huge view at rope way are good option.
review: We go savitri temple via rope way that charge a 92 rupees of both way and this temple is devoted to Lord brahma wife temple and great view of pushkar you can see top of the temple.

title: Temple of Devi Savitri
review: Savitri Temple is very renowned Temple for Hindus as well as foreign tourist. Evening time is an ideal time to visit this site and perfect point to enjoy little hiking.

title: excellent view from the height of the savitri temple
review: excellent view from the height of the savitri temple but good option if you want take stair so rope way is the best option to go savitri temple and evening time sunset is so awesome .

title: Nice Temple in pushkar
review: This Temple is dedicated to desolated wife of Lord Brahma, Savitri. And this is located on the top of Ratnagiri Hill. Its walk able distance from Lord Bramha Temple. You can take rope way or steps but better option is rope way to visit this temple. And From temple you will get nice view of the Pushkar city.

title: I love this pushkar temple because of huge view of pushkar.
review: I love this pushkar temple because of huge view of pushkar mind feel very relaxed at the top of savitri maa temple.

title: Best place to see a whole pushkar view from the top of temple.
review: Best place to see a whole pushkar view from the top of temple. i like the view a lot and rope way ios easy way to going savitri temple.

title: A Must Visit Holy Place
review: We were told that earlier when there was no rope-way to reach this shrine,very few people used to visit this Hindu temple......What a shame!!!! This place is worth a visit with or without the rope way,which is more of a tourist attraction.....

title: Great views
review: You can either hike up to the temple or take the easier way out and take a gondola. The views are great from the temple. The best part was that there were no pandits there to nag you to do some puja or the other. Positive vibe

title: Glorious view
review: We wanted to see the sunset so took the cable car up as the steps down in the dark didn't look too safe. Great views on the way up and after scrambling about a bit on the top settled down to watch the sun go down. On one side of the hill are fields and trees and on the other semi desert. Very pleasant.

title: good view to pushkar
review: Good place to see the Pushkar from above. The monkeys there were a bit aggressive to people haha. The temple is ok.

title: Amazing sunset view
review: Savitri temple is dedicated to the goddess Savitri who is one of the wives of lord Brahma, the Hindu god of creation who has a temple dedicated to him near pushkar town. The temple is at a hilltop which can be reached via cable care which would cost around 90 Rs. There is also a stairway for those who prefer to climb up all the way. The hilltop is an excellent sunset view point where we can also enjoy the scenic beauty of the whole pushkar town

title: Beautiful Vista
review: We went here 3 weeks ago and it was the high light of our tour in Pushkar. The cable car is worth taking at only 80rps return. The view from the temple is breath taking. Plenty of black face monkeys too.

title: Amazing views!
review: If in Pushkar you should definitely give this a try!

title: Amazing view of the surroundings
review: A pretty hard climb up the hill under the burning sun, but It's easily doable in 30-40 minutes. Really worth it, but of course you can also take the cable car for 92 rp (92 rp for both ways or just one, doesn't matter). The temple at the top is not that interesting, but the incredible view of the surroundings is really worth it. Best at sunrise or sunset of course!

title: Ropeway is the best way to going savitri mata temple
review: When I go that time I don't know savitri temple devi is lord Brahma temple and the temple priest is very carding to all devotee and you can see all pushkar view from the top of savitri mata temple's my suggestion to tourist best way is the ropeway if going there

title: Best sunset view in Rajasthan!
review: This temple is probably where I got to view most amazing Sunset with everything you need. The city view surrounding lake, might and picturesque Aravali mountain range, a bunch of grey langar monkeys, the rope car ride which they ll pause high for the view. Must visit in Pushkar. Head to this place by 4.30 pm and till 6.30 eve is best time to be here. You can climb the stairs as well.

title: ropeway is the key attraction
review: less than half a kilometer from the Brahma temple, there is a ropeway facility to access this temple. The ropeway stops mid way for 30 seconds both ways to take in the view from the top. One can get a panoramic view, riding the cable car. The temple is closed between 12 pm and 2 pm and hence it is important to get the timing right. A lot of monkeys abound the place with people feeding them

title: Worth the hike! Go for the views, not the temple.
review: Bit of a struggle climbing the stairs in 35+ degree heat and after 8 weeks of eating bulk carbs with limited exercise but I made it. Took about 25 minutes with a few mini breaks in between. The temple isn't much to look at but the views of Pushkar and surrounding mountains were amazing!! Definitely worth it. Don't opt for the lift if you're physically able to walk. The stairs are very doable and you will save some rupees.

title: Nice view poor Temple
review: Try to Come in the sunrise. The cable car opens at 7:30 so you will have to climb the stairs. Its a long way up so take at least half an hour for climbing.

title: Nice view
review: A quick ride up the ropeway to have an amazing view of Pushkar Lake and the surrounding hills and landscape.

title: Circle round the back of the temple for a nice view
review: Go round the back of the temple and if you are up for it hike a bit slightly beyond the rocks for a nice spot to watch the sunset against the mountains in peace.

title: Nice plCe
review: Good views. Worth a visit. Take a pair of socks if you don't want dirty feet.

title: If not just for the view
review: Savitri Temple is well worth the time to visit built 1687 and perched a top of Ratnagiri Hill (some would say rather steep) and dedicated Lord Brahma's wife Savitri.

title: A temple on a hill top
review: The Savitri temple on the top of the hill can either be reached walking up the steep hillside....partly covered by steps and some places just a path. We took the Cable car, which apparently had started in May of 2016.

title: Perfect Sunset Temple Experience
review: We very much enjoyed sunset at the Savitri Temple.  We took the gondola up, did a quick visit/pooja at the small temple, then enjoyed exploring the hilltop for views of the surrounding valleys and Pushkar lake at sunset.  It was a delightful, peaceful, experience.  We walked back down the approx 700 steps and made our way back to Pushkar Lake on foot (a bit confusing to find in the dark) but a very pleasant evening!

title: Views.
review: Don't even think about getting the cable car unless it's absolutely necessary. The 20-30 minute walk is challenging but rewarding. The top provides a complete view of Pushkar in all its beauty. We went to the temple for sunset which I advise. Make sure you leave enough time to descend in the light though! The path isn't entirely lit and can be unstable.

title: Panoramic view of pushkar
review: Just 1+ km uphill walk from Brahma temple will bring you to Savitri temple which is a small yet famous temple among locals. One can walk up and down or take the gondola (Rs.92/- both ways/pp). Amount is same for one way too. Also, one person is free for every 3 persons. It not only gives you a very nice view of the holy pushkar but also the 360 degree view of the Aravalis (camel safari area, mountains, villages, highway roads, railway station (pushkar) etc. Go before sunrise (else its too hot by 9am).

title: Great views !!!
review: Well worth the visit for the views but nothing special for the temple it's self. It's a nice hike up about 20mins and you can take the cable cart down.

title: Beautiful view - excellent rope way !
review: The temple is situated on a hillock over looking the Pushkar town ship. The temple by itself is small and is still being beautified. The way to the top is through a rope way. The starting point has to be reached by an auto or own vehicle. They have a a beautiful garden at the base with a few shops selling curios and eatables. The climb up the hill in the rope way is very good as the inclination in the final stages reaches a gradient of nearly 75 degrees. The view from the cable car as also from the temple s excellent. Photography of the deity is prohibited . The idol is beautiful and needs to be shown to more people so that more tourists and devotees visit it.

title: Great view of Pushkar and lovely sunset
review: Visit this place if you have enough time to enjoy bird's eye view of Pushkar. Be on the hill a little before sunset which would be an ideal time It takes about 2-3 hours in whole.

title: Only the view
review: If you allready see the city from an high place, so no need to go, it's only few square meter temple that you caan even not see what's inside.

title: Good view
review: This temple is although clean  but to reach at the top you need to go by stairs which are around 700 steps. If you can't walk then a rope way is there but after reaching the top it is only the views of the city which is really good to see. You can see few monkeys also at the top. Overall it was a trip not so religious but a viewing destination.

title: Incredible views of Pushkar
review: Great morning workout to the top of the mountain to the temple. Chai tea at the top is delicious and a welcome reward for the climb. The temple is quite basic unlike other Hindu temples  nonetheless, it is interesting and the views make up for it.

title: Get Blessings from Ma Savitri
review: Must visit place when u visit Pushkar. Cable ride is amazing and high safety is maintained. Most of the people visit to pushkar dont know about savitri ma temple. Local administration should inform properly to tourists that Savitri temple is there. Amazing views you can see of pushkar when u take the cable ride.

title: A must do!
review: Walked up here on New Years Day 2017 to see the sunrise. Beautiful! The temple itself is small and simple. The masala chai at the top was one of the best I had in India!

title: Best place to see setting sun over pushkar
review: Generally people tend to skip it but its not something  to be missed if visiting pushkar.

title: Awesome View!
review: The climb is a short one. Very Scenic landscape. Perfect to end the day. Caught up with a whole lot of langurs on the top. Worth a visit for sure!

title: Awesome cable car experience.
review: While in pushkar do not miss the cable car ride to the savitri mandir. It costs only 80 rs per person and the experience is awesome. You get an awesome aerial view of pushkar town and the desert beneath. The cable car boarding point is at a walking distance from Pushkar town or the mela ground.

title: Good view
review: The view from here is nice but the temple itself does not offer much to see. The cable cart ride up is very cheap (they don't charge extra for foreigners so it was under 100 rupees but can't remember the amount exactly) and a nice experience so I recommend taking that instead of climbing up. However, if you have had a chance to see the views from somewhere else there is no point in going here.

title: good t reach by ropeway trolly
review: many thanks to local administrations for starting rope way, people like us can go up to temple easily. its very beautiful temple on mountain and birth taking view of pushkar and soundings.

title: GREAT VIEW !!
review: Visit this temple with a steep climb to the top.The view is surreal and one can see the whole pushkar town and beyond !!!

title: Panaromic views of Pushkar
review: The Savitri temple is situated on a hill top and very easily and conveniently connected with cable car. The return trip costs Rs 92. You can walk up to the temple as there are proper steps. The top offers beautiful views of the Pushkar city.

title: Savithri temple
review: I feel this is a must see place for anyone who believes in Hinduism. Great place and very attractive on the hill top. Cable car is also very convenient to onto the top of the hill. Loved the scenes also.

title: Great Experience of Rope Way to Temple
review: Temple is situated at the peak of hill and recently government develop a rope way, but stairs option are also available. 80 Rs (+ Service tax) per person is fare for travel via rope to temple. It is great experience of rope way second time. They stop the trolley for 30 second at the peak point for visiting the view of Pushkar. It is really very great journey to me but also I am scared when trolley was stop in mid-way. I personally recommend to try rope way for temple visitors instead of stairs. Savtri temple view cover whole Pushkar. But be-aware there is also monkeys and catches eatable things from hands.

title: Worth the climb!
review: This temple dedicated to Savitri, the first wife of Lord Brahma. So it is close to the more famous Brahma temple.  A long series of steps lead to the temple as it is situated on a hillock.  Alternately, you can use the ropeway. From the temple, you can catch a nice view of the adjacent lake and temples.

title: STUNNING VIEW
review: It's a long walk up the hill ... but well worth the effort. The view is stunning looking over the holy lake city of Pushkar. The temple's inner sanctum is a quiet refuge for prayer and meditation.

title: Sunset can't be better
review: Its just a 25 mins climb from pushkar and offers a sunset view like no other . Cable car is available for those who don't want to walk .

title: must visit place - lovely view
review: It's a long walk to the hill, use rope way instead. You can experience awesome Puskar view from this temple. A must visit place and also this is in walk-able distance from bus stand.

title: Must visit in Pushkar
review: With the ropeway, visiting Savitri temple on the hilltop is a breeze. Very ancient and pious temple. Great atmosphere and superb view of entire Pushkar town.

title: Arial view of Pushkar
review: You can reach Savitri Temple by walking or through a  rope-way. The temple is simple but the view from the hotel is very nice. You can see the Pushkar Lake and also the city from here.

title: A Pushkar must-see
review: Perched atop a hill overlooking Pushkar Lake and the surrounding area, Savitri Temple should not be missed. The temple itself isn't particularly interesting or photogenic, but the views are with the trip. The 30-minute hike is a moderate incline until the end when it gets pretty steep. Benches along the way provide plenty opportunity to stop and enjoy the view. There's a cable car for those unwilling or unable to make the hike. Visit the small cafe at the top, which serves chai and snacks.

title: Religious place,peaceful feeling--
review: Those who come to Pushkar for a religious journey it is place to see,others can also visit for a peaceful feeling,this is a small temple on the peak of a small hill,though no more rich in architecture but rich just in feelings,now rope way is available for going to temple --thanks---SSS--

title: stunning view
review: we climb up to to this Mountain by walk and as soon as we reached there the view of pushkar was amazed, beautiful sunrise view across to lake

title: Magnificent view from the top of the hill
review: After visiting Brahma temple, we went to Savitri temple on 13th Nov 2016. We had to walk around 2 kms from the temple to the rope way (cable car). Savitri temple is situated at the top of the hill. So we opted for rope way. Charges per person (to & fro) for the cable car is Rs. 92/-. The panoramic view from the cable car was magnificent. The cable car halts for around 1 minute on the way for taking photographs.

title: Physical labour reqired
review: U need to climb so many stairs before u reach the place so its better to start early in the morning .

title: Must visit
review: Awesome place to visit with family and friends. We visited the temple last weekend during Pushkar fair. We really enjoyed the trek to the temple complex. The views from the hill top is really mesmerising.

title: Sand, not sunset
review: Its a nice walk. We did it early to watch the sunset but, the air is so poluted that we could'nt see anything. But it was a nice trip.

title: Perfect for Sunset
review: One of the most popular temples of the town situated on top of a hill, accessible by rope way or by foot. You get an amazing view of the whole Pushkar town from this place. Its also one of the best places in town to enjoy the Sunset.

title: Funfilled Ropeway Ride
review: Since the Temple is at a peak and the walking way is also not that good govt has jnstalled Ropeway  for to and from journey which attracts devotees and travellers both.  Being at a height, it has a good view point for Sunset and if you are visiting Pushkar or Ajmer then i will surely recommend visiting this plave.

title: Amazing views
review: To be completely honest, it is just worth for the views of Pushkar. The temple itself has nothing to see. You have two options, either walk all the stairs or take the cable car. We took the cable car as that day was quite hot, but the steps are not that difficult. Perfect to see the sunrise or sunset.

title: Delightful experience
review: Have been to this place twice before and went by steps.This time we went by rope way...which was such a delightful experience that cant be expressed in words(though sometimes scary for me and my daughter). You can also take steps to reach this place nothing can equate that experience but you will really enjoy this adventurous trip also.Midway it stops for 30 seconds so that people can take photographs.You will have a spectacular view of whole Pushkar. Overall a great experience would recommend people to try this...

title: Disappointing to Expectations
review: Other reviews are correct, the temple is horrendous, it looks like a city building that has been plopped on top of the mountain.

title: Views Views Views
review: Beautiful, uninterrupted and clear panoramic views of the town of Pushkar, the neighboring hills and the dunes. Definitely a great place to catch the sunset or sunrise.

title: Nice views
review: Before sunrise mountaineering experience in India in somewhat special. The climb rewards you with beautiful views of Pushkar and the lake. To be completely honest, however, the temple itself is very small and the place itself is in terrible condition (stray dogs, piles of trash etc,); what a pity.

title: Nice View
review: it is very good temple and it is located in pushkar.you never miss this if you go to ajmer.it is near to ajmer

title: Great view
review: Great view from the temple porch and its surrounding .  The inside of ths temple isnt interesting for a western tourist.  The ropeway cost of 92 rupee (2 way) was worth is,  but if you're in good shape you can try the staired lane.  Last ropeway back was 19:30. Rickshaw from the city market 100 rupee.  Back was 120 (monopoly...).

title: An amazing view
review: We walked from our hotel in town 2k up to the temple. Most people would catch the cable car (or rope way) but although a hard climb it was a very worth while experience to see the amazing view of Pushkar and greet the locals and other local tourists as we walked. You get an understanding of the geography of the area, the town on the lake and surrounding hills, sand dunes, rose and marigold gardens, and even all the camels gathered for the fair. It was an  experience not to be missed.

title: Must go for trekers!!!
review: Savitri temple is located on a mountain located about 2 KM near the Pushkar lake. We went trekking all the way from hotel to the temple and believe me it was awesome. We felt light and blessed when we reach there. The view was awesome and can see whole pushkar.

title: Panoramic views
review: Easily connected with a cable car, the ride costs only Rs 92 for a return trip. The views of the entire Pushkar city are beautiful. The temple attracts a lot of devotees.

title: Sun point
review: Be it sunset or sunrise, this place beats most places hands down. Its about a 30 mins trek or if you are too lazy to trek, take the ropeway. Ample space on top to have an ideal lonely sunset and sunrise.

title: Nice Hike
review: About 20 minutes walking from the lake and another 30 mins hike to to the top (There is a cable car for 90 INR, return) - offers great views of the town and beyond.

title: darshan at savitri temple
review: Savitri temple is one of the attraction of Pushkar.Reahcing the temple from valley  is very attractive and withstanding the valley in the mid for 30 seconds is a gud experience .overall view of pushkar from the top is very fantastic. a must visit place in pushkar

title: Rope way experience is awesome..
review: You can take a rope way trolly sit in very affordable price at only 93 rs., if childs and aged parents with you then they will very happy because in both of them ages this experience will be memorable for them, &  of course the scenario from that hite is beautiful and awesome... So when you reach there take a experience of trolly..

title: Beautiful Trek. Beautiful View. Beautiful Sunset.
review: Savitri Devi Temple is a historic temple, located at the top of a mountain next to Pushkar. The trek to the temple is all stairs made of stones. There are several resting area present on the trek to enjoy the full view of Pushkar and Pushkar Lake and people taking camel rides to the left. Do see the sunset from the top of the hill.

title: A place which I remember always.
review: I have been there in the year of 2004. Long back. I was around 15-16 years old. I remember road was not road. There was 200+ stairs and after that trek. I have done that. It was a awesome experience. I heard that work on progress and till temple gate it will full stairs. I don't think that happens.

title: India Tour September 2016
review: The ropeway trip up to the temple is not to be missed if you are in Pushkar.  The trip takes about 10-15 minutes in an enclosed car and stops half way up to allow photos. The trip can be very hot so choose your timing well.  The view from the top is spectacular.

title: Sunrise delight
review: Don`t postpone this visit as we did - waking up before sunset is definetly worth the impressions you get at the top. The stairs are rather long and may scary someone, but nobody makes you hurry. Take your time, don`t forget to take water with you. Lots of monkeys live on the top, so take care about your belongings - especially, if you have food among them!

title: outstanding view
review: rely nice view .during the day is  hot take with you enough water at the temple bottle of water is very expensive

title: Amazing walk and view
review: You can desiderosa whether take the ropeway or walk up to the mountain but when will you arrive up there if you have been crazy like me you will feel paid back of any effort.

title: Amazing
review: Its very good Place. I really love to this place and feeling good after reach there. whenever i go to Pushkar than i always went there and spend 2-3 hours and feel relax.

title: Excellent views from the ropeway
review: Interesting access to the temple via a ropeway cable car which offers some great views of the overall pushkar landscape.  Our first real experience of rajasthan's unique landscape with the Aravalli hills providing a lovely backdrop

title: Beautiful view
review: Hike up! It will be more fun, it takes an hour and little more from Brahma Mandir .. The rope way gets you up faster but if you are fit and love hikes - hike up.

title: One sight and whole pushkar..Savitri Temple
review: If you want a clear picture of what pushkar is.. Go to Savitri temple. Located in the hill behind Brahma temple..its is and old place of worship.. As per locals it was established with the Brahma temple.. Lots of devotees visit to offer themselves to Mata Savitri..Also its the best place to view Pushkar as whole...There is two ways to reach on to of hill..1)Climb the steps if you never tires..2)Use the cable car which cost 80 Indian Rupees Now (can't be sure of changes :))..well its worth to visit this place as you can enjoy the beauty of pushkar with a almost sky view

title: A nice stroll.
review: An excellent mornings outing from Pushkar. Only fifteen minutes walk from the lake.Although it takes about an hour to walk up the view is well worth it.

title: Savitri Temple
review: Very beautiful temple on the mountain and now enjoy the ropeway also. give ur mind peace and relaxation.  nice place to meditation.

title: temple with a adventure of mountaining
review: this temple having a historic and religeous importance. its was fun to reach there with friends through walk up bt now there ropeway also available. view of city from up was awesome

title: View of Pushkar is beautiful the temple is ordinary
review: Worth going up for the nice view. The temple is not exciting. The climb took me 35 minutes and was pretty tiring I recommend going in the morning and wearing good shoes.

title: Amazing views of Pushkar
review: This temple, situated on top of a hill, is accessible by track as well as cable car.

title: enjoyed rope-way
review: we took rope-way ride at savitri temple and the view of pushkar town is awesome and we enjoyed a lot..

title: MUST GO!
review: The view from up there is Awesome. You can sit there for hours and gaze at the city with amazing breeze.

title: Cable car in india
review: You need to ride a cable car to reach the temple since it is located top of the mountain. The view is just amazing, you can see the desert and rock boulders. Though the temple at the top is small.

title: Unique One
review: I was there many time and again this year.  It's perfect place for go and practice meditation,  very shanti place with real feeling.  Go and enjoy !

title: Breath taking view
review: Visited on 14 June. Now trolly service has been started. One can visit this place in 1-1.5 hrs.

title: A jewel of Rajasthan
review: Since i am not very much into forts i really enjoyed Savitri Mata temple in Pushkar.

title: experience of visit via ropeway. wow !
review: We experienced temple visit via ropeway & it was very good to be there during morning time. view is best from the top of hill of entire pushkar town & you could enjoy your chaaaii at the top. Rs 100 is approx charges for ropeway per person.

title: Improved and clean
review: A pilgrimage to many. People from all over India comes here to pray. Ropeway to the temple gives you a scenic view of Pushkar city.

title: Ropeway makes the visit easy
review: I did not know the ropeway is available.

title: Nice
review: Nice temple. Great feelings. Travelled on camel to visit this temple. The shaky shaky feeling on top of camel was a  Nice amazing experience.

title: Great Temple
review: The temple is a very powerful but relaxing place.  I have been coming here for years making the trek up the mountain annually.  The images have great energy.  The breeze and views at the top are worth the effort.

title: Quick hike to Savitri Temple
review: Quick hike up to Savitri Temple, took about 15-20 mins to get up there to watch the sunrise and the view is amazing! The temple is beautiful and people were accepting to our group. Would recommend!

title: The Only mandir of savitri
review: This temple is situated above pushkar lake, in pushkar where one has to climb up , the uphil a distance of 1, 5 km. it is ideal to start climbing up the stairs early in the mornings so you can reach in time spend some time & walk down before hot sun catches you. Yet it is worth visiting as you can have a experience both treking as well the spiritual

title: Amazing sunset
review: After doing our camel safari, we decided to head up to the Temple for sunset which was a 10 minute walk nearby and a half hour ascent. Great climb, got the blood pumping.. Especially in the heat! Outstanding views to the side and behind. You gain more of an appreciation for the pilgrimage site of Pushkar lake.

title: Stunning views cute monkeys and heck of a hike
review: NOT SUITABLE FOR THE UNFIT OR PEOPLE WITH BACK AND/OR LEG PROBLEMS DUE TO THE CLIMBING

title: nice place to see the sunrise :)
review: We went in the morning to see the sunrise and we had a beautiful view of the town, lots of monkeys having their morning routine, and nice contact with the town people coming to the temple along the way.

title: camel fair ground view
review: short walk with best view excellent photos from there expetially at sunset , or early in the morning...just beautiful

title: "Best view"
review: It was very hard to climb to the hill but it really worth it. You can have the splendid view of the pushkar. The they sell on hill is the best chai we had so far in India.

title: Short walk up to the temple, great view on Pushkar!
review: Something around 1h to walk (try to go outside of heat peaks), easy to find your way. Great activity to do in Puskhar asides from the shopping!

title: good but very far
review: this temple is on mountatin..i been once but coudnt dare 2nd time...need energy and patience to walk

title: Wait till cable car ready
review: Cable car is ready but not yet open. After that it will be easy to go there. At present you have to be physically fit to go there.

title: "AWESUM VIEW "
review: Hard to climb on hill but it really worth it. Mono Rail is also available for reached at Temple. you can have the splendid view of pushkar. i really enjoy alot.

title: WOW!!! Thank you Savitri!!!
review: Super walk up to this temple, and the view is extraordinary.  Thank you Savitri. Powerful temple, and you get to contemplate many thoughts as you walk up the mountain, the steps are very solid and wide so there is no problem with loose rocks.

title: Worth it for the view
review: The walk/climb up to the temple is actually quite picturesque. It gets pretty steep the higher you go, but it's worth climbing it for the view of the city once at the top. Be careful as you go up as you will almost definitely have to walk through groups of monkeys (some of which are quite big).

title: Main attraction of Pushkar
review: Fantastic view of the desert, worth climbing 30 minutes the hill.

title: Worth it
review: The view from the top of the hill was one of the highlights of my India trip. Interesting temple. Amazing spot to look down on Pushkar and enjoy the view of the surrounding valley.

title: great morning hillclimb
review: It is with getting up early and get to the base so you can see the sunrise from the top. 30 minutes should be enough and the view with a cup of ginger tea from a vendor is marvelous.

title: evening view
review: sit on the hill top to enjoy the sunset and the calm distant land. its a tough climb but worth it. its peaceful n refreshing for sure.

title: good view, not much of a temple
review: After a long and hot walk, you finally get to a tiny temple with a small shrine, very much like dozens I had already seen without climbing so much.

title: mountain trance
review: make sure your climb is early morning as early as possible. now rope way will be open from April 1st (may be - depends on indian govt). but if you can climbing is best. it is recommended to carry a small snack with you. water bottles are available uphill. If you are religious once definitly the savitri temple is your destination. and if non religious, climb the mountain walk past the temple to the back yard, climb a few meters uphill and then you may find some small tree and shady places and rocks where you can chill out and have your snacks and be in trance. if you like to read and talk on spirituality with your loved ones this is the best place.

title: Beautiful views and cheeky monkeys
review: We climbed up to the Savitri Temple early in the morning yesterday and really enjoyed it. It's easy walking distance from town - just ask at the Brahma Temple, from there the bottom of the hill is about 10 minutes walk. We reached the bottom at 6am and were at the temple by 6.30am. It's mostly a fairly easy uphill walk, and just gets a bit trickier towards the end, but there are steps the whole way. Once you get to the top there's a guy selling chai, which at 40 rupees is a bit steep but I have to say it was an especially delicious chai. There are wonderful views of Pushkar, as well as lots of monkeys running around - hold onto your stuff, one of them tried to steal my entire backpack!
