It's definitely worth going early before it's too hot, plus at that time there won't be many other people about and it's very peaceful. A cable car has been built and apparently it's in the testing phase so should be open soon - but I imagine the downside of this is it will get a lot more crowded up there!

title: very nice view
review: a lot steps to go up - but the nice view above is worth it! temple was closed so we did not see it but could get a chai at the top

title: Worth the Hike
review: First things First..it might seem like a fairly moderate hike from the base but that is not the case ! Having said that, trek to Savitri temple is worth the time and the energy as you get the best panoramic views of the Pushkar town. The trek gets quite steep towards the second half dotted with uneven boulders. Start early and make sure you get to see the awesome sunrise from the hill top. Beware of Langurs which are in abundance specially close to the temple.

title: Incredible sunrise views
review: Made the trek up here very esrly in the morning, drove by scooter from Zostel hostel to the car park at the bottom and made my way up, ñretty tough for first thing in the morning but a nice sugary cup of warm chai awaits you st the top of the temple alomg woth chocolate, crisps etc. I went up alone to fully appreciate the beauty and relaxation that you can easily find up there at that time n the morning, an absolute must if you are n Pushkar, especially for those keen on photography, if the weather is just right, you will leave with some oitstanding photogaphs...

title: Good exercise and nice views
review: Walking up the stairs was a welcome exercise for me and my kids after having spend too many hours in the car previously. The views were a great reward for the hike but the temple itself rather disappointing. The good thing though at this temple was that nobody was expecting and/or asking for any donations. On the way down beware of cheeky monkeys. We brought these eatable blessed "pops" down with us from the temple in a transparent plastic bag and the monkeys were so cheeky that they ripped open the bag with the pops falling out. Seemed to me like an exercise they haven't done the first time.

title: Sunrise Trek
review: Stunning sunrise trek up the hill - take a rest if you need to. And cash for Chai at the top. The views from the back are incredible too!

title: Nice Hike Up the Steps
review: Good place to stretch your legs and climb the steps to the top.  Good to get some exercise after all those curries.  Took about 30 minutes each way.  There is a cable car alternative (however it didn't seem to be operating when we were there - perhaps it only operates at certain times of the day and/or year).  The best views of Pushkar are at sunset (where the sun is behind you).  Don't leave it too late to come back down as the steps aren't lit.  Walk around to the back of the temple (via the dirt tracks) to get the best sunset view.  We had a very nice and amicable auto rickshaw driver who took us there and back.  His name was Sattu (telephone 9414666961).

title: Religious
review: Temple of wife of brahma ji.on the mountain little more to travel but nice to visit and pay respect and take blessings.must recommend to visit

title: On the top of Pushkar
review: It took me half an hour to get there, not so hard but totally worth it. You can see the whole town here. Worth a visit to enjoy a beautiful scenary

title: Great View and Place
review: After a great trekk walking at the top when the breeze flew it feels awesome nice view now rope way is also going to start so it will attract more people there

title: All senior people who can walk can access to this temple.
review: All senior people who can walk can access to this temple. Great view of Pushkar. View to see Mela ground and lake. If you can walk, you must be there. it takes an hour to arrive the temple from the road.

title: Lovely temple with beautiful views from top
review: The temple, view from the top and sacred worship of the goddesses at the temple are well worth the arduous hike...don't miss it

title: Nice View of Pushkar from top.
review: We started in the morning at 5.00 am, after visiting to Brahma's temple,we  took the narrow lane on the right side to go to Savitri temple.There are stairs as well as sloped pathway leading to temple.The temple is not having any remarkable architectural interest but the journey is wonderful- it takes about 2.5 hours to go up and come down.

title: Most enjoyable place in Pushkar
review: The walk up the hill and the view on top was the best trip we did in Pushkar. A lot of locals walk up there to pray at the temple, its an about 45 min. walk, we also met really cute black goats with light dots on their furr and white ears ;-) and on the top there are a lot of monkeys. Totally worth a visit!!

title: Good views
review: Good views from the top of the hill.  Go early- it gets hot.  Watch out for the monkeys near the top, but they won't bother you if you don't bother them.

title: Great sunrise or sunset hike!
review: This is a fairly challenging 'walk', it takes around 40 minutes to go up and 20 to come back down. Good shoes are recommended! The view from the top is spectacular. A 360 degree view of Pushkar and the surrounding desert and mountain landscapes. If you continue on behind the temple to the edge of the rocks it is very peaceful and you have a spectacular sunset view. The sunrise comes over Pushkar town. There is a small chai and beverage shop at the top.

title: Nice view
review: It took about 30 minutes to reach the top from the bottom of the hill. The place is free to enter and the walk isn't too hard.

title: Good walk during a early morning
review: Savitri temple is nothing to talk about. Walk there is great. You have a  brilliant view and exercise is good. Steps are uneven so good footwear is essential. I found baboons mild- not aggressive like I expected. They were in group of 20. Early morning walk was so quiet, there is not many quiet places in  Pushkar.

title: Good exercise
review: We did the climb/walk up the hill to this temple at sunrise. It is good exercise! Higher up the steps are steeper and more uneven. Good view when you get to the top, though it wasn't very clear the morning we went. The temple at the top is nothing much. Mind the monkeys, as they will grap your camera, water bottle, or anything else.

title: Quite a Climb
review: quite a climb but worth it as you get the complete view of Pushkar and the hills beyond. Its better to trek to the temple early morning in order to avoid the harsh sun.

title: Hell of a Hike
review: Savitri Temple is a very steep hike, so good for exercise..Be prepared to sweat! Temple itself is small and nothing special.

title: Great view, do it in the early morning
review: If you are in Pushkar go for this early morning trek. Do it BEFORE sunrise, it is quite a cardio exercise. We started around 5:30 (check the distance from your hotel and the time of the sunrise)

title: "splendid view of pushkar"
review: its very hard to climb up to this hill in beganing but once you reach there it provide a great view of pushkar lake &city.all the city looks white&white.i also recommend a chai shop just outside the temple.it serve very good chai.

title: The Savitri Temple
review: This temple is dedicated to the first wife of Lord Brahma.

title: Beautiful Review
review: Located high on mountain in Pushkar town. You can get nice view from this place.  Would be better if visit this place early morning. Sunrise is amazing from the top.

title: Go for the view...and the trek!
review: The temple for the first wife of Lord Brahma is atop a small hillock close to the Brahma temple in Pushkar. Beware it is a proper trek up.

title: Quite a climb!
review: From a distance it looks like a smallish hill, but once you start it's turns out to be quite a hot and strenuous climb, however great views make up for it, also you will meet cute monkeys! There is construction in progress, a cable car apparently...the temple at the top is nothing special, just go for the view... A shop at the top sells cold drinks and tea, very handy!

title: Jay matadi
review: Savitri mandir is just behind the bramha temple on the mountains.

title: Superb climb up to a small temple - one of the few peacfull places we found in India ! Very peacefull....
review: We adored our treck up to this small temple overlooking the town.

title: So many steps to climb, but worth the visit!
review: I first heard about this temple from the locals. I heard many good things about temple being very powerful and local married women go this temple for long life of their husband. When I visited this temple in September -15 , construction of lift is going on which should be done in less than 4-6 months time. However, if you choose to climb, be prepared to have lots of water to carry with, also there are monkeys close to the temple main door and they will try to snatch anything you carrying. Wonderful top view of the whole Pushkar town. If possible, go early hours of the day as its very hot during afternoon hours. Elderly people are not advised climbing the steps , nor children. Good Luck!

title: Seriously hot
review: Best to avoid in summer - the locals are lovely, but they were so hot and bothered and couldn't believe a tourist would choose to put themselves in this heat. Don't trust the bottled water -  unless the lids are tamper proof. I saw the kids picking up discarded bottles and refilling them.

title: For Heights lovers
review: good place to go if you are in pushkar,

title: Unbelievable view
review: The steep climb to the top is will work it when you see the view over Pushkar. Temple itself is quite small and similar to most small temples in the area.

title: great temple
review: this temple is on the rock.beautiful  pushkar was nice city . to many temple there. Pushkar has a magnetism all of its own – it's quite unlike anywhere else in Rajasthan. It's a prominent Hindu pilgrimage town and devout Hindus should visit at ...

title: A trek To Holy Abode
review: A great trek to the historical temple,  but a tough one in the scorching heat. Breath Taking panoramic view. Must be good during monsoon or winters

title: Too far from city
review: The temple was interesting as a rare Brahma temple site.  The distance travelled however made it not worth the trip.

title: view of pushkar from temple height
review: view of pushkar from temple height  you can see whole pushkar from one place the view is awesome

title: Soothing trek
review: This temple is 4 KMS from Brahma temple. 1.5KMS of walk and 2.5KMS of trek. The trek consists of combination of small steps and stone built steps. On reaching the top, the view is breathtaking.

title: Walk dont Run
review: This is quite a steep climb for us older folk, but the kids fly up and down it. Nobody said it was going to be easy. Fantastic panoramic views from hilltop until the complete the chair lift which is in the process of being built. The Savitri Temple itself is lovely and  quite peaceful, but remember no photos.

title: good
review: good I like to go early morning when the sunrise up...

title: Amazing morning hike to beat the chill!
review: Its a comfortable 2 hr hike (entire trip) carry light though because its a little steep. The journey is just long enough to absorb the spectacular view...

title: Ohm, Shanti!
review: We're a middle-aged couple and not in perfect health, so this wasn't exactly an easy journey up the mountain for us. However, something beautiful happened along the way up...a pilgram was returning to the bottom as we were ascending and called out, "Shanti, Shanti!" to us. Oh, yes! Peace, peace...instead of continually looking ahead at the long journey, we walked in peace, each step a new experience and fully embraced. It became much easier from that point onward...a peaceful journey to the top and back. We met so many lovely people along the way.

title: Nice to walk up to the hills for view of Pushkar...
review: It is just out side of Pushkar and can be nice walk at evening time and see the view from the top.

title: Excellent view of Pushkar & desert
review: The temple is on a hill top, which is top most point of Pushkar. We climbed steep steps for around an hour to reach the top. We went in the evening and had Sun set view in the desrt. The temple is small and old dedicated to Maa Saraswati. The view of Pushkar on one side and the desert on the other side is excellent. Choose either morning or evening to climb to avoid hot Sun.

title: Temple of Goddess Savitri
review: The temple is dedicated to Goddess Savitri, wife of Lord Brahma sitated on Hilltop near brahma Mandir. You can see an ariel view of Pushkar and desert from here.If you start early evening you will be able to watch Sun-Set. We have to climb for one hour to reach on top.

title: Stunning scenery
review: It is a steep climb in parts and is good cardio exercise, but worth it once you get to the top and enjoy the view, especially good if you're there for sunrise. The climb itself takes between 15 and 40 minutes with a few places to sit on the way up, however the steps are just cut rock towards the top so take proper shoes. There is a temple at the top and and a small shack where you can get drinks if needed.

title: Worth the climb!
review: The temple itself isn't the most spectacular, although it definitely has its own charm to it. The climb is gruelling as well, particularly in the midday sun, so stick to sunrise if I were you.

title: Definitely worth the climb
review: Stunning views from the top, steep climb up. There is a cafe at the top with water and snacks. Lots of monkeys on the trail so avoid carrying food with you (they are not shy to come up and take it). Definitely a must-see in Pushkar!

title: savitri temple
review: gud place should go and find the good art work there and even its a kind of a adventure visiting this  place situated on the top of a hill

title: Sunrise and chai
review: The hike to this place is a bit tedious but worth it. Go before the sunrise and enjoy the tea you get at the top. It an experience you should try and get in during your stay at Pushkar

title: Perfect way to start a day !
review: A lovely temple about 45 min walk from Pushkar past the Brahma temple.  It gives a good view of the city and is the perfect way to start the day looking at the sun. Start early as it gets hot walking.

title: A Must see for trekkers - I Just loved it!
review: This savitri temple is on the top of Ratnagiri Hill which is in pushkar. This hill is around 1-2 km from lord brahma temple.

title: viewpoint
review: temple itself is not so interesting but it's definitely worth to climb Ratnagiri Hill. whether for the sunrise or sunset you will be rewarded with the great view of Pushkar and surrounding desert.

title: Amazing View!
review: The favourite thing I have done in the entire country so far! Walking up the hillside isn't too difficult and the reward at the top is incredible! Such a fantastic view of Pushkar and the surrounding areas, the temple at the top is very quaint and gives 360 degree views of the Pushkar area which is very rewarding and peaceful. Highly recommended.

title: Some good views in a nice day
review: We hiked up to this temple for sunrise in Pushkar. The temple itself is not overly spectacular but the views over Pushkar were good, despite the disappointment of a hazy morning.

title: Long climb
review: We climbed to the temple today. We are in our 60's and found the climb challenging. It took an hour and the grade was 45 degrees at times. The path was just rough stacked stones in places. The temple is OK but the view is nice despite the haze. A guy at the top watched our shoes. When we finished viewing the temple, we went to tip the guy. The shoes were there but he was gone. We asked a guy in the adjacent shop if he knew where the shoe guy had gone. He said "Oh, he is out to lunch."

title: Visit if you have extra time..not much great view from top
review: You will need flat 2-3 hours to complete this temple if you intend to go to the top and come back. We had halt at Pushkar and hence we had decided to go to the top. We completed the full trek to the top and back in 2 hours flat. Many people have said view from the top is very nice but that is not so true. I did not find the view to be very great..its was just an ok. You can skip trek to the top if you are short on time. Work of ropeway al the way to the top is in progress.

title: Sunrise Hike up to Temple
review: We did a sunrise hike up to the temple during the Pushkar Fair. We took a camel cart from our tent camp through the fairgrounds (fun to see everyone waking up) and arrived at the base of the hill about 6:30ish. The hike up is very steep with many rocky steps. It is definitely for those sure of foot.  Uphill is quite the cardio work out and down hill will work your knees and ankles. Wear sturdy shoes! At the top of the hill there is the temple and a small stand that sells tea and bagged snacks. There were a few places to sit as well to catch your breath.  Watching the sun rise was very pretty, but it was very overcast and the views weren't the best of the surrounding areas. I definitely suggest going on a clear day if possible. My husband loved the hike, perhaps because his cardio is better than mine! I was huffing and puffing the whole way up and didn't enjoy the view quite as much.  He carried our toddler on his back in a carrier.  I think it would be hard for young children who can't be carried.

title: Sunrise
review: We travelled up here for sunrise... amazing views! The sun slowly rose over the mountains and the light streamed into the valley. The lake is beautiful from up here, and part of Ajmer can even be seen!

title: Incredible sunrise!!!
review: This was actually the best thing I did in Pushkar, heading up the hill for sunrise.

title: A temple with a view
review: Savitri temple, as it is popularly known, is in fact devoted to three Godesses, Sharda, Savitri and Sarasvati. It sits at a spectacular location in Pushkar, on a small hillock, from where you get a beautiful view of the town and the surrounding plains and hills.

title: Get way to start a day
review: Go up the climb for sunrise. The view is amazing up there. The climb will get you blood pumping a bit. When we were there there was a cow that lives at the top and monkeys around. Good entertainment (but monkeys are everywhere). The temple is nice with a great spot to sit and look out at where you staying.

title: Must visit
review: Beautifully located at the top of the hills with great views of Pushkar and Mountains. There are two ways to reach the temple - either chair lifts or walk up there. Walking is good if you have health and time. Spend few hours. Monkey business is literally in plenty.  Try to visit during late evening, Sunset is breathtaking. You will not be disappointed

title: Savitri Temple Pushkar
review: A must for those on a religious trip to Pushkar

title: Great views of Pushkar!
review: Amazing view of the whole village of Pushkar, great for sunrise. The walk can be challenging for people who don’t like stairs but it’s relatively easy. To find it, just follow the mountain, looking at the cable car. You will find steps, take then to the top. If you feeling tired to go down walking you can always take the cable car down or the way around. I am not a big fan of the temple itself as I am not religious but the walk is great and the view breathtaking!

title: A most amazing view
review: Walk up the mountain, or catch the cable car for the most stunning views of the whole area. They do close for lunch so its worth checking how long you will have up there when you buy your cable car ticket. There is a beautiful temple on top of the mountain and a little gift shop. There are many monkeys up there so bring something to feed them if you like or buy something there as they do sell food for the monkeys. Don't get too close to them though . If you are coming to Pushkar I recommend a visit to this temple, and also the one on the opposite mountain if you are fit enough to walk up. A truly wonderful experience.

title: Good scenic view.
review: The temple is situated at the mountain top. There are 2 ways of reaching the temple from the base. either go walking or take a to and fro cable car, which is a good experience. There is asmall temple at the top, with good scenic view of whole city.

title: Hill Top Temple offers panoramic view of Pushkar
review: A very simple temple on top of the highest hill near Pushkar which can be accessed by steps by sport loving young people and also by rope way for easy going or those with less time in hand. It gives a breadth taking panoramic view of area around Pushkar with Brahma Sarovar in the center.

title: Sunset
review: This temple is on the hill. There are two ways of going to the temple one is by way of stairs approx 1100 stairs and the other is the rope way . We had gone by using rope way or cable trolley you may call them. The best time to visit this place is when it is about to have sen set. A spectacular view of sunset and the whole Pushkar can be seen from the temple and the hills . Must visit

title: Go there for the view
review: We went there today by car from Ajmer. You won't find much traffic in Pushkar as you will follow the outer route to reach here thus avoiding the city. As mentioned by others, there are 2 ways to reach to the temple at the hilltop, through stairs or through ropeway.

title: good workout
review: the new steps made the climb easier. if you feel being lazy, take the gondola, the views are fantastic, i hope they are opening a chai shop in the not finished building on top

title: Holy place
review: After offering prayer at Brahma Temple we went to see Savitri Temple. Nice view of temple from hill top
